text: How to declare array of zeros in python (or an array of a certain size)
I am trying to build a histogram of counts... so I create buckets.
I know I could just go through and append a bunch of zeros i.e something along these lines:

code:
buckets = [];
for i in xrange(0,100):
    buckets.append(0);

text: is there a  more elegant way to do it?
I feel like there should be a way to just declare an array of a certain size.
I know numpy has numpy.zeros but I want the more general solution
